instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.PP3V3R3V0_AON: What is PP3V3R3V0_AON? PP3V3R3V0_AON is the first power rail you need to get a USB-C charger to go from 5v to 20v on an A1534 Macbook with an 820-00045 board..
definitions.PP5V_G3H: What is PP5V_G3H? PP5V_G3H is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a G3H mechanical off state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not Powering up
threads.message:
Have a 2016 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board not powering up. No sign of water damage or corrosion.

Here are the measurements taken:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 8.6v
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL> - 20.09v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> - 8.7v
<SIGNAL>PPVBUS_LIO</SIGNAL> - 20.11v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.32v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3R3V0_AON</SIGNAL> - 33v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL> - 4.92v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5.02v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> - 0v

Also CPU is warm.
Resistance of <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 1.2ohms. Pulled all 3 (<CAPACITOR>C0900</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C0901</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7880</CAPACITOR>) caps to confirm none were shorted and the short remained. I'm assuming <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> is specific to the board? Also the fact that the CPU is warm, is it possible that's it's the cause of the short, since <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> runs to the CPU as well?

Any suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not Powering up
threads.message:
Looks like bad PCH/CPU.
No other reason to find warm CPU in S5 state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not Powering up
threads.message: Trash like 99% of the 12? MacBooks. You can pull <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> just in case but this is likely fucked

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Not Powering up
threads.message: Yep. Pulled <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>, short still present. Confirmed trash board
